alert.note: Alert for Hendricks; Putnam (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 26 at 4:44PM EDT by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Hendricks, southwestern Boone, southeastern Montgomery and northeastern Putnam Counties through 515 PM EDT ... At 444 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 14 miles southeast of Crawfordsville, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northwestern Hendricks, southwestern Boone, southeastern Montgomery and northeastern Putnam Counties, including the following locations... North Salem, Jamestown, Advance, Bainbridge, New Ross, Carpentersville, Ladoga, and Roachdale. This includes Interstate 74 between mile markers 47 and 56. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
